name: Open Coffee
description:
Open Coffee Club is a casual gathering of people involved/interested in founding, operating or funding startups. The format is similar to Startup Drinks, but in the morning and with coffee.

The vibe is more hangout than event and provides people with a regular time and location to talk shop, discuss news, ask questions and and meet others in the startup community they may only see occasionally at more formal events.

We're meeting 8:00 - 9:30 am on alternating Tuesdays at Nelson the Seagull, 315 Carrall St, Gastown.

For more information and background, please see the Open Coffee Club post on the Pixel Crafters website.

See you there!
how_to_find_us: We'll be at the big table on the left. Come grab a seat!

name: TECH OPEN HOUSE
description:
BC Tech Jobs and Spacekraft are hosting a Tech Open House on March 30th at the Spacekraft headquarters! The Tech Open House is being held by BC Tech Jobs in collaboration with Spacekraft, the BCTIA, the Tech Talent Meetup, and the Burnaby Tech Meetup. 

This is a great opportunity for tech professionals and job seekers to network with some of Vancouver’s most sought-after companies, who are looking for rock stars in Development, QA, Data, UX, Product, Project Management and other technical areas. Candidates can meet company representatives face-to-face, discuss current opportunities, drop off a resume, and leave a positive impression to continue the conversation later!

Event Details: 

When: Wednesday March 30, 2016 from 5:30 pm to 8:30 pm

Where: Spacekraft #[masked] Kingsway, Burnaby, BC

Who: Developers, QAs, UX, Data Analysts, Product Managers, Project Managers, and other technology-focused roles welcome!

Companies Attending Include:

• Traction on Demand

• Boeing Canada - Aeroinfo

• Tantalus

• DDS Wireless

• GroupHEALTH

• Hypersecu

• Monstercat

• News360

Candidate Registration: 

This event is FREE for job seekers but please note that space is limited, so please RSVP to attend.

Companies Looking to Attend:

REGISTER FOR THE EVENT HERE

See you at the Tech Open House!

Please note that this event is catered to technology companies and technology-focused candidates only. If you are a professional services firm, please contact us atwww.bctechjobs.ca and join our Meetup Group to stay tuned on future events that might be of interest to you.

name: Startup Drinks Vancouver
description:
Startup drinks are a casual gathering at the end of each month for anyone who's interested in startups. We meet at 131 Water in downtown Vancouver and we chat about all things #startups...projects, funding, challenges, etc.

This is a great opportunity to connect with others in the community and a great way to connect on a regular basis.

See you there :)

name: Finding your ideal Co-founder
description:
RSVP here!

Have an amazing idea for a new business, but think you need a partner to help get it off the ground cause you don't have all the skills or know-how to do so? We're here to share our knowledge and experience on co-founder hunting and help you find your best fit.

Come out and discover the answer to your dilemma as we go through our tips on starting up smart, cofounder etiquette, and pitching your idea.

Key Learning Outcomes:

• How to Start Up Without "Tech" or Industry Expertise And Why Everyone Should (In the beginning) 

• Finding and Pitching Your Idea To Cofounders

• Do's and Don'ts of Cofounder Etiquette 

• Where Do You Go From Here?

RSVP here!

name: CodeCore Demo Day - January 2016 Cohort
description:
Come check out web applications built by CodeCore's latest developers.

CodeCore is a 12 week intensive training program for Web Software Development with a focus on Ruby on Rails, Javascript, JavaScript Frameworks (like React.js) and more.

Thinking about hiring a new developer? Wondering what can be built by a graduate of our bootcamp? If so, this is the place for you!

Come watch demos of projects our students have created, with time for a brief Q&A afterwards.

What to expect:

Entry Level Developers with previous CS/programming fundamentals and development experience

Developers who have been trained in Ruby on Rails, Javascript, Popular APIs, Test Driven Development, and Agile Methodologies

A range of impressive web applications, mobile application and hardware applications!

Complimentary food and refreshments will be provided!
Please sign up here:
https://www.picatic.com/codecore-demo-day-jan-2016-cohort

name: Wishpond Open House: April 2016
description:
Hi Everyone, we are having our monthly open house you are invited to come and have some pizza and soft drinks.

Come hang out with all of the guys and gals at Wishpond! Find out who we are and what we do. We are a friendly group of people that want to get to know our community better and would love for everyone in the Vancouver tech scene to come by and enjoy themselves.

Our beautiful Coal Harbour office is located on the corner of West Georgia and Nicola, only an 8 minute walk from Burrard Skytrain Station and 12 minutes from the Canada Line, Vancouver City Centre. Join us for a night of pizza, ping-pong, foosball, video games, and refreshments.


The Itinerary for the night...

• 5:30 everyone can start funnelling in, we want to make sure everything is ready for you guys

• Mingle, get to know everyone, have something to drink, but most of all: have a great time!

• 7:30 we're going to try to wind things down around here and disperse to carry the party on to other places :)

You should come here if you like any of these things:

• Meeting great and fun people.

• Playing ping-pong against some of our champs

• Playing foosball. You can try to beat our CEO, but good luck!

• Pizza! (with some vegan and gluten free selection)

• A wide selection of Juices and Soft Drinks

We're looking forward to having you here! Please RSVP, so we know how much food and refreshments to get.

If you'd like to learn more about what we do here at Wishpond then please visit: http://www.wishpond.com

Oh, we're also hiring, https://www.wishpond.com/careers

If you have any questions, leave a comment or message me. Thanks, Jason.

DO NOT REPOST THIS EVENT, ESPECIALLY ON ANOTHER SITE.

how_to_find_us: We'll be at the big table on the left. Come grab a seat!

name: FinTech Conference 2016
description:
2nd Annual FinTech Conference in Vancouver 

Fintech is disrupting banking, lending, payments and finance, innovating with mobile technology and the shared economy. 

Canada is emerging as a FinTech hub with startups attracting sizable investments. The Digital Finance Institute, Canada's prestigious FinTech think tank, is proud to support the development of FinTech in Canada with its 4th FinTech Conference, #FinTech2016. Join us for a day of engaging discussions and insight from many of the world's leaders in FinTech from the US, Canada and Hong Kong that ends with a night of FinTech networking at a rooftop patio bar in Yaletown with senior executives from major tech companies, hot startups, advisory firms, consultants and investors. 

For more details about the schedule, speaker line up and registration click HERE


Presented by the Digital Institutue of Finance

name: SalesHacker Vancouver: Meetup
description:
Panel: Fuelling Your Sunny Career in B2b Saas Sales

It's not summer yet, but fear not! We invite you to join us for our third Vancouver Sales Hacker Series event.


It's never too early to learn from other Vancouver Sales lovers about developing your sunny career in saas sales.

We'll kick it off with a panel of Vancouver's top sales leaders sharing stories and insights on b2b saas sales career trajectories, and on staying motivated, fulfilled, challenged, smiling & successful.

Next, we'll jump into small, focused roundtable discussions on breakout topics including goal setting, specializing for success, the AE track, and the management track.

We'll send you home with some new Saleshacker friends, actionable insights to set yourself up for sales success in 2016 and beyond.

We'll provide the pizza, the beer, and the leaders to guide our conversations. Everything except a sun tan!

All you have to do is show up ready to participate, share, and learn!

Purchase your tickets at: https://www.universe.com/saleshackeryvr

how_to_find_us: We'll be at the big table on the left. Come grab a seat!

name: Picking the right Structure for your Startup
description:
RSVP here!

Non-profit? For-profit? Co-op? Partnership? Sole-proprietorship? 

You're out to change the world for the better, but what's the best way to do it? We're hosting an animated panel discussion with entrepreneurs who have chosen to operate their businesses under different structures.

You will:
• Understand why they chose to operate their businesses in the selected format. 

• Learn about Pros & Cons of each structure. 

• Gain insight on the differences in Resources & Funding options available to each structure. 

• Have the opportunity to network with fellow entrepreneurs and changemakers.

RSVP here!
